ai.summary: A scenic 14.3 km moderately challenging hike that links Devil's Dyke and Nomansland, offering chalk downs, heathland, and expansive views across the countryside. The route suits hikers with some experience who enjoy varied terrain and open landscapes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly on well-defined chalk paths with rolling ascents and descents, open downs and heathland; some sections pass through woodland and grassy tracks. Ground can be uneven and muddy after rain, with exposed edges on ridges and potential wind.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changing weather and varying daylight. Stay on official paths, especially near cliff edges at Devil's Dyke. Bring a map and compass or GPS, and tell someone your route and expected finish time. Wear sturdy boots, carry enough water and snacks, and be mindful of other users on shared paths. If walking with dogs, keep them under control and in sight.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; can be tackled year-round with proper gear and daylight.

seo.meta_description: Explore a 14.3 km moderate hike linking Devil's Dyke and Nomansland in the UK. Enjoy chalk downs, open heathland, and panoramic views with practical safety tips and gear suggestions.
